events.name: PyData Meetup - June 2017
events.description:
Agenda  • 6:45pm - 7:00pm Networking • 7:00pm - 8:00pm Presentation: Introduction to Azure’s Machine Learning Framework Gerald Goh is a technical evangelist at Microsoft Singapore’s Developer Experience &amp; Evangelism Team. He is a full stack developer with over 5 years experience developing web applications. He currently does Python and is working on DevOps, Infrastructure, Data Engineering and Distributed Systems. 

Updates •  Join us on Facebook and Twitter  https://www.facebook.com/groups/pydatasg/https://www.twitter.com/pydatasg Sponsors   Group Sponsor
events.location: Microsoft Singapore Auditorium, Level 21, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence and How To Get Started
events.description:
"When I look at where computing is heading, I see how machine learning and artificial intelligence are unlocking capabilities that were unthinkable only a few years ago. This means that the power of the software — the ‘smarts’ — really matter for hardware more than ever before.""

- Sundar Pichai (CEO of Google)

Sundar believes the last 10 years were about building a mobile-first world, turning smartphones into remote controls for our lives. But in the next 10 years, the shift will be towards a world that is AI-first, a world where computing becomes universally available — be it at home, at work, in the car, or on the go — and interacting with all of these surfaces becomes much more natural, intuitive, and intelligent.

Many tech giants today have been investing resources into developing their machine learning and AI capabilities. These includes Amazon, Facebook, Microsoft, IBM and many others.

So what is AI and machine learning?

In this session, Annabelle Kwok (Founder and CEO of SmartCow) will introduce us to the world of AI and machine learning. SmartCow is Singapore's leading company that builds edge-computing devices and provides end-to-end A.I. Driven solutions for industries.

Register Here
https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/introduction-to-artificial-intelligence-and-how-to-get-started-tickets-27522382186
events.location: Toa Payoh Public Library, 6 Toa Payoh Central, Singapore 319191

events.name: Introduction to Kotlin
events.description: Super excited to announce the first meetup of Kotlin User Group Singapore. There would be two introduction talks:• "What is Kotlin and why should you care" - dive to the technology behind Kotlin-JVM, Kotlin-JS, Kotlin-Native and using Kotlin for Android development.• "Kotlin in action" - overview of language itself, it's syntax, unique features and IDE's support. Agenda (even better we will have 2 talks and livecoding session!!!): 19:00 - 19:20 Registration and hangout time  19:20 - 19:30 Welcome words  19:30 - 20:00 “What is Kotlin and why should you care?” by Ilya Vorobev. Ilya will cover history of Kotlin creation: motivation, platforms’ support and community behind language.  20:00 - 20:30 “Kotlin in Action” by Denis Nekludov. Livecoding session!  20:30 - 20:45 Refreshment break  20:45 - 21:15 “Kotlin: A new hope?” by Andrey Mischenko. Overview of cool language features.  21:15 - 21:30 - Closing of event
events.location: Google Asia Pacific, 70, Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Mapletree Business City, Singapore 117371
